data.value: - Offal Breath inflicts these debuffs: - Poison (magic DoT potency 10, 20s) - Nausea (20s) - Slow (20s) - Blind (30s) - Heavy (20s) - Silence (10s) - Paralysis (30s)

data.name: EnemyNote_HeavenOnHigh_61_7340
data.value: - auto-attacks inflict stacking poison (physical DoT potency 10 per stack, max 8 stacks, 30s)

data.name: EnemyNote_HeavenOnHigh_71_7359
data.value: - Rotation: - Freefall (immediately when pulled) - Golden Talons x3 - Freefall - Winds of Winter - Be ready to stun or LoS

data.name: EnemyNote_HeavenOnHigh_71_7357
data.value: - Be careful near mammoths when you've used a Pomander of Concealment, as Prehistoric Trumpet will break the effect

data.name: EnemyNote_HeavenOnHigh_71_7358
data.value: - Does not make an effort to come into melee range unless Golden Tongue is interrupted

data.name: EnemyNote_HeavenOnHigh_81_7373
data.value: - Rotation: - Goobbue's Grief - Moldy Phlegm - Goobbue's Grief - Inhale + Moldy Sneeze - Goobbue's Grief - Time for roughly 3 auto-attacks before it restarts (another Goobbue's Grief)

data.name: EnemyNote_HeavenOnHigh_81_7375
data.value: - You can duck behind a corner as it uses Rush to steer it into the wall. You'll still take damage, but it can give you a chance to heal before it's in range to auto-attack - If LoSing Earthquake, you can peek out between stomps for uptime, but the timing is weird. Damage is applied when it hits the ground as expected, but it snapshots your position earlier, as its feet come off the ground

data.name: EnemyNote_HeavenOnHigh_81_7374
data.value: - If you let it do one auto-attack after Vile Utterance and then duck behind a corner, you should avoid the vulnerability up

data.name: EnemyNote_HeavenOnHigh_81_7367
data.value: - You can duck behind a corner as it uses Buffet to steer it into the wall. You'll still take damage, but it can give you a chance to heal before it's in range to auto-attack - For melee jobs, try standing behind it during its casts to delay its next auto-attack

data.name: EnemyNote_HeavenOnHigh_81_7365
data.value: - These mostly just spam abilities, doing very little auto-attack damage - Try to stand behind it during Dragon's Voice and Breath attacks to delay its next auto-attack - Voice and Breath abilities are all treated as spells, so an impeding trap can interrupt one in an emergency

data.name: EnemyNote_HeavenOnHigh_81_7366
data.value: - Hits hard, and doesn't stop to use abilities so the damage is constant - DO NOT pull while it has the attack bonus - Be very careful fighting other enemies nearby

data.name: EnemyNote_HeavenOnHigh_81_7370
data.value: - Elbow Drop can be baited to delay its auto-attacks; just don't get hit by it!

data.name: EnemyNote_HeavenOnHigh_91_7389

data.name: FloorsetNote_EurekaOrthos_001
data.value: - The arena is a 3x3 grid of mines (pachypodium mine adds) - Rotation: - Authoritative Shriek - Authoritative Shriek - Mandrastorm - Mines activate in rows with the middle always being first. Stand in the third row to activate and move into the first after it explodes. - At level 85, a Doga demiclone will defeat the boss in about 7m15s with no player assistance

data.name: FloorsetNote_EurekaOrthos_011
data.value: - Initial actions: - Offensive Command: summons 3 adds in a Y shape - Stand beside any of the adds - Offensive Command: summons 5 more adds to complete the circle - Stand beside the one tethered add that doesn't have another tether across from it - Piercing Laser - Order Relay - see note below for safe spots - Rotation: - Piercing Laser - Piercing Laser - Offensive Command for 5 random adds - Stand beside a tethered add that doesn't have another tether across from it - Order Relay - see note below for safe spots - The two sets of 4 adds for Order Relay will each be a group of 3 and a solo add, separated by the solo add for the other set. To dodge the flames, start in front of the second solo add, then move to the first solo add after the first flames are done - A Doga demiclone will defeat the boss in about 6m with no player assistance

data.name: FloorsetNote_EurekaOrthos_021
data.value: - All damage other than the boss's auto-attack inflicts vulnerability up (20% per stack, 1m) - Initial actions: - Creature of Darkness - Dark Wyrmtail OR Dark Wyrmwing - Dark Megaflare - Whei Morn - Dark Wyrmwing OR Dark Wyrmtail - Rotation: - Creature of Darkness - Dark Wyrmtail OR Dark Wyrmwing - Whei Morn - Dark Wyrmwing OR Dark Wyrmtail - Dark Megaflare - Whei Morn - Dark Wyrmtail OR Dark Wyrmwing - The first two Dark Wyrm actions will be either tail followed by wing or wing followed by tail. Likewise, the 3 tail/wing actions in a single rotation will always be either tail-wing-tail or wing-tail-wing - A Doga demiclone will defeat the boss in about 7m45s with no player assistance

data.name: FloorsetNote_EurekaOrthos_031
data.value: - Opening sequence: - Twister - Meracydian Cyclone - Meracydian Squall - Turbine - Twister - Meracydian Squall - Twisting Dive - Rotation after opening: - Twister - Meracydian Cyclone - Meracydian Squall - Turbine - Getting hit by a Cyclone or Squall AoE inflicts vulnerability up (10% per stack, 30s) - The arena has an outer damage ring which inflicts windburn (unique DoT potency 200, 15s, cannot be removed with Esuna) if you step on it - Simple strategy for Meracydian Cyclone/Squall: - Find the open center-to-edge path for Turbine - Drop two Squall AoEs at the edge (the first one won't land until the third AoE appears) - Move inward, drop the other two Squall AoEs - Move to the center and wait for Turbine - A Doga demiclone will defeat the boss in about 4m30s with no player assistance

data.name: FloorsetNote_EurekaOrthos_041
data.value: - Initial actions: - Songs of Ice and Thunder OR Thunder and Ice - Leftbreathed Thunder OR Rightbreathed Cold - Thunderous Cold OR Cold Thunder - Leftbreathed Thunder OR Rightbreathed Cold - Rotation: - Cacophony - Leftbreathed Thunder OR Rightbreathed Cold - Thunderous Cold OR Cold Thunder - Leftbreathed Thunder OR Rightbreathed Cold - Songs of Ice and Thunder OR Thunder and Ice - Elements not important for Left/Rightbreathed. For other abilities, pay attention to the order of elements in the ability name - ice/cold is pointblank and thunder is donut - All ice/thunder AoEs deal 900 potency magic damage (~50k to a DPS/healer) and inflict vulnerability up (20% per stack, 1m) along with deep freeze (magic DoT potency 150, 6s) or paralysis (15s), uncurable with Esuna - Ram's + Dragon's Voice combo is survivable with steel - Charge tether is potency 2700 when too close, which will one-shot DPS/healers through steel - A Doga demiclone will defeat the boss in about 4m45s with no player assistance

data.name: FloorsetNote_EurekaOrthos_051
data.value: - Rotation: - Octuple Swipe - Disorienting Groan OR Bullish Swing - Bullish Swipe (random target) - Thundercall - The boss rotates to face the player before Octuple Swipe, so the first swipe will always be toward the player. The first four swipes are in the order front > back > right > left, and the next four are either the same order or reversed - Trick for Octuple Swipe: - Stand outside of the first spot - The only attack that might repeat in the same area is 4 and 5 - If there is no repeat, follow all of the attacks - always stand where the last one hit - If there was a repeat, follow the attacks until the one that repeats. Wait for both hits in that area, then move into it and stay there - A Doga demiclone will defeat the boss in about 8m15s with no player assistance

data.name: FloorsetNote_EurekaOrthos_061
data.value: - Rotation: - Steel Claw - Ferocity (random target) - Preternatural Turn - Roar - Preternatural Turn - Preternatural Turn with crystals: - If the boss is doing a pointblank AoE, the crystals will do wide conal AoEs toward the outside of the arena. The safe spots are between the farthest crystal and an adjacent one, a bit closer to the far one and outside of the pointblank - If the boss is doing a donut AoE, the crystals will do pointblank AoEs. The safe spot is a small triangle just inside the inner circle of the boss's hitbox toward the far crystal - Unei can provide all the heals you need as long as you don't get hit by anything avoidable - A Doga demiclone will defeat the boss in about 10m15s with no player assistance

data.name: FloorsetNote_EurekaOrthos_071
data.value: - Rotation: - Resonance - Barofield (only used on first rotation) - Nanospore Jet - Nerve Gas (Centralized, Leftward, or Rightward) - Nerve Gas (Centralized, Leftward, or Rightward) - Auto-cannons fire during this cast - Nerve Gas (Centralized, Leftward, or Rightward) - Auto-cannons fire during this cast - Magnet tether appears - Nerve Gas (Centralized, Leftward, or Rightward) - Auto-cannons fire during this cast - Nerve Gas Ring - Magnet attract/repel happens just before this cast finishes; there is a quick moment to adjust when the telegraph appears - Auto-cannons fire at the same time - Getting hit by Auto-cannons or any Nerve Gas attack inflicts vulnerability up (10% per stack, 30s) - North and south adds are always negative. West and east adds are always positive - If you are solo, you will always be bound to the north add, which spawns behind the boss - Use steel if you're not confident, so you can easily survive a hit from any of the Nerve Gas abilities - A Doga demiclone will defeat the boss in about 10m45s with no player assistance

data.name: FloorsetNote_EurekaOrthos_081
data.value: - Rotation: - Support Systems; spawns: - 1 Interceptor α (egg) outside one side of the arena - 5 Interceptor β (cubes) in a row along one side of the arena, close to the egg - 1 Interceptor γ (sphere) inside the arena - Interception Sequence - dodge adds in the order of markers - Peripheral Lasers OR Cross Lasers - Laserstream - Support Systems; spawns: - 8 Interceptor β (cubes) along the north side of the arena - 8 Interceptor β (cubes) along the east side of the arena - Parallel Execution - dodge the circle AoEs while also getting to the safe side of both sets of firing cubes (wait for one to go off and run quickly into that space before the next goes off and hits you) - Support Systems; spawns: - 6 Interceptor β (cubes) along the west side of the arena with spaces beside the first and last at each end - 6 Interceptor β (cubes) along the north side of the arena with spaces beside the first and last at each end - 1 Interceptor α (egg) on the east side of the arena - 1 Interceptor α (egg) on the south side of the arena - Salvo Script - pay attention to the direction the eggs are facing - safe spot is always in the far corner of a single square that is the second from the corner of the arena - if both eggs are facing inward, safe spot is between the two eggs - if one is facing toward the corner between the eggs, safe spot is on the far side of the other egg - Peripheral/Cross Lasers will one-shot DPS/healers through steel - All abilities except Laserstream inflict stacking vulnerability up (10% per stack, 1m) - An onion knight demiclone will defeat the boss in about 6m with no player assistance

data.name: FloorsetNote_EurekaOrthos_091
data.value: - Opening sequence: - Paradoxum - Caliburni - one set of blades - Thermal Divide - Blades from Caliburni fire back across the arena - Call Dimensional Blade - Solid OR Empty Souls' Caliber - Rotation after opening: - Caliburni - 3 sets of blades - Paradoxum - one set of blades turns to fire, and another to ice - Frostforge OR Flameforge - you'll need to make sure your buff is opposite of this - Blades from Caliburni fire back across the arena. If you have the same element as the boss prepared, make sure to get hit by an opposite element blade - Solid OR Empty Souls' Caliber - Frost's OR Flame's Revelation, depending on which was prepared - Exglacialis OR Exflammeus - Thermal Divide - Soul of Fire/Ice increases damage from the same element to 10x normal, so everything becomes a one-shot - An onion knight demiclone will defeat the boss in about 10m with no player assistance

data.name: FloorsetNote_HeavenOnHigh_001
data.value: - Rotation: - Concussive Oscillation - Overtow from center of room - Amorphous Applause

data.name: FloorsetNote_HeavenOnHigh_011
data.value: - Rotation: - Proboscis - Psycho Squama - Proboscis - Neuro Squama - Butterflies appear along the perimeter at the same time - Psycho Squama - Butterflies all explode at the same time, inflicting big damage and paralysis - TLDR: Stay close to centre so everything is easy to dodge

data.name: FloorsetNote_HeavenOnHigh_021
data.value: - Opening sequence: - Lightning Strike - Cloud Call - Shiko - Make sure you're far from the boss and stand under a cloud. You will break the cloud, creating a safe spot, as the other clouds will all do AoEs a moment later - stay in the safe spot until after this - Lightning Strike (wait until cloud AoEs before dodging) - Rotation after opening sequence: - Lightning Strike - Lightning Strike - Supercell - Cloud Call - Shiko - Supercell (wait until cloud AoEs before dodging)

data.name: FloorsetNote_HeavenOnHigh_031
data.value: - Rotation: - Tornado - Ancient Aero II - Whirlwinds appear along the west and east sides of the arena - Ancient Aero III - Whirlwinds explode immediately after this, so make sure not get get knocked into them - Ancient Aero - Ancient Aero II - Whirlwinds appear along the north and south sides of the arena - Ancient Aero III - Ancient Aero

data.name: FloorsetNote_HeavenOnHigh_041
data.value: - Rotation: - Rusting Claw - he stops and raises a hand to indicate that he's readying this - Words of Woe - he stops, looks at the target, and stands still for a moment before firing this - Eye of the Fire - Orbs appear and boss drops proximity marker. Orbs will do telegraphed pointblank AoEs at regular intervals. Get away from the boss, but also away from the orbs - The Spin - big damage if you're close to the marker, and very little if you're half the room away - Orbs disappear as he does his next Rusting Claw

data.name: FloorsetNote_HeavenOnHigh_051
data.value: - Rotation: - Firewalker - First set of 4 Accursed Canes appears - Second set of 4 Accursed Canes appears - Fire II - at the same time, the first group of canes does donut AoEs - Second set of canes does donut AoEs - Topple - At the same time, the first group of canes does line AoEs at random players - Second group of canes does line AoEs - Canes disappear and a new group of 8 appears - Fire II - All 8 canes do donut AoEs. The centre is always safe from these, and there are safe spots to the outside of each cane - Ancient Flare - All 8 canes do line AoEs at random players. These are easiest to dodge if you bait them toward the walls - TLDR: Lots of AoEs to dodge

data.name: FloorsetNote_HeavenOnHigh_061
data.value: - Rotation: - Predator Claws - Slabber - Innerspace - Ululation - stay OUT of puddle until after this - Hound out of Hell - get IN the puddle when this targets you - Devour - stay IN puddle until this, then get OUT - Ululation - make sure you're OUT of puddle - TLDR: Be OUT of puddle for Ululation > IN for Hound out of Hell and Devour > OUT for Ululation - Innerspace targets a random player each round. Hound out of Hell and Devour are used on the same player - If you take no damage from Hound out of Hell, it will not stun you. Make sure not to leave the puddle until AFTER Devour

data.name: FloorsetNote_HeavenOnHigh_071
data.value: - Rotation: - Heavensward Howl - Eclipse Bite - Summons ice chunks that will explode in a large untelegraphed pointblank AoE if hit by the icicle, other exploding chunks, or Lunar Cry - Icicle appears on one side of the arena with telegraphed circle AoE, then does a telegraphed line AoE shooting across the platform - Lunar Cry - Eclipse Bite

data.name: FloorsetNote_HeavenOnHigh_081
data.value: - Rotation before 85%: - Burning Rave - Knuckle Press - Aura Cannon - Rotation after 85%: - Ancient Quaga - Meteor Impact - drops proximity marker under Onra; several black orbs also spawn around the room and pulse pointblank AoEs that inflict heavy - Aura Cannon - Burning Rave - meteor drops on proximity marker, and black orbs disappear roughly when this cast starts - Knuckle Press - Melee uptime strategy: - Place 3 markers along the wall, using the posts for reference: - A by the post at 3:00 - B 2 posts north/counter-clockwise from A - C 3 posts north/counter-clockwise from B (just right of the exit) - Do whatever for the first 15% - doesn't really matter. - Before Onra hits 85%, position him so that he's standing on the A marker and facing south - When he starts casting Ancient Quaga, go behind him. This prevents an auto-attack immediately after Ancient Quaga - Wait for Onra to turn around and make one auto-attack. This is important for positioning Meteor Impact - Immediately run just past B. You need to move right after the auto to avoid a black orb AoE. You want Onra to stop on the B marker - Wait for one auto-attack, then run to C, which will get you out of Aura Cannon - Wait for Burning Rave, then move to B - Wait for Knuckle Press, then move Onra back to A facing south - Repeat from Ancient Quaga - The delay from the Meteor Impact cast to the meteor actually dropping is random. Rarely it can drop *very* quickly, even before Aura Cannon, and deal potentially fatal damage. Steel can help mitigate this risk for jobs that can spare it

data.name: FloorsetNote_HeavenOnHigh_091
data.value: - You must touch the Empyrean Shrine at the far end of floor 100 to secure your victory. It takes about 15 seconds to run across the floor without Sprint - You gain the title for soloing once you touch the shrine. To set it for your screenshots while still inside, use this text command: /title set "Lone Hero"

data.name: FloorsetNote_PalaceOfTheDead_001
data.value: - Rotation: - Whipcrack - Stormwind - Bombination - Lumisphere - Aero Blast

data.name: FloorsetNote_PalaceOfTheDead_011
data.value: - Rotation: - Bloody Caress - Acid Mist - Gold Dust - Leafstorm - Boss runs to north end and stays there until after Rotten Stench phase - Two Palace Hornet adds appear - Rotten Stench x3 - Kill adds quickly, or they will use Final Sting, which does 70% max HP damage (each) - Lust can be used to AoE down the adds quickly while continuing to DPS the boss as well

data.name: FloorsetNote_PalaceOfTheDead_021
data.value: - Auto-attacks are conal AoEs - Rotation: - Dissever - Ball of Fire - Ball of Ice - Dissever - Ball of Fire - Ball of Ice - Boss runs to center of room - Fear Itself - Make sure to stay out of middle for the fire/ice balls to keep a safe spot for avoiding Fear Itself

data.name: FloorsetNote_PalaceOfTheDead_031
data.value: - Rotation: - Ancient Eruption (x4) - Adds: 2 Nightmare Bhoots appear - Entropic Flame - Accursed Pox - Entropic Flame - Accursed Pox - Scream - If adds are still alive at this point, prey will cause them to cast Tornado, likely killing you - Shadow Flare

data.name: FloorsetNote_PalaceOfTheDead_041
data.value: - Rotation: - Until 90% health: - Dark Harvest - In Health (donut) - In Sickness - Uses Black Honeymoon once at 90% health - From 90% to 60% health: - Cold Feet - In Health (x2: pointblank, then donut) - Dark Harvest - In Sickness - Uses Black Honeymoon once at 60% health - Below 60% health: - Cold Feet - In Health (x2: pointblank > donut OR donut > pointblank) - Dark Harvest (x2) - In Health (donut) + adds - Summons untargetable adds outside the arena which will cast either a single circle AoE (potency 250) or four line AoEs (each potency 300), resolving shortly before In Health - Avoid the AoEs, then run toward Edda to dodge In Health - Black Honeymoon - Stay close to avoid In Health easily - But be careful of the disease debuff from In Sickness in the first half of the fight - Make sure to turn for Cold Feet

data.name: FloorsetNote_PalaceOfTheDead_051
data.value: - Rotation: - Geirrothr - Hall of Sorrow - Valfodr - Flames appear around the edges of the arena and do telegraphed pointblank AoEs at the same time. Make sure to get knocked into a safe spot or use knockback immunity. The flames explode a couple seconds after the knockback, so there is a bit of time to adjust. Flame explosions deal 70% max HP damage - Geirrothr - Hall of Sorrow - Bleed DoT does not stack (standing in overlapping puddles does the same damage as standing in just one) - With sustaining potions (or other job utility) you can position yourself on the wall midway between two candles and just sit in the puddles for the entire fight - The flame AoE telegraphs are buggy and sometimes don't display - stay away from the flames even if you don't see the telegraphs

data.name: FloorsetNote_PalaceOfTheDead_061
data.value: - Rotation: - Drench - Electrogenesis - Douse - Fang's End - Hit Sprint when it uses Drench if you're still heavied to escape Electrogenesis safely - Make sure to drag the boss out of the Douse puddles

data.name: FloorsetNote_PalaceOfTheDead_071
data.value: - Rotation: - Thunderbolt - Charybdis - Thunderbolt - Trounce; runs to the east end of the arena to cast this - Charybdis - Thunderbolt - Charybdis - Trounce again, but from the west end - At 10% HP, the boss casts Ecliptic Meteor once, then returns to the rotation

data.name: FloorsetNote_PalaceOfTheDead_081
data.value: - Rotation: - Scalding Scolding - Sap - Grey Bomb spawns along with several untargetable Lava Bombs - Grey Bomb starts using Burst immediately with a long cast time. It must be killed before this goes off to prevent big roomwide damage (80% max HP) - Lava Bombs all use Self-destruct after a few seconds. This is a telegraphed pointblank AoE, so don't get caught in the middle of them - Sap - Sap - Another Grey Bomb, but no Lava Bombs this time - Scalding Scolding - Sap - Sap - Giddy Bomb spawns along with several Lava Bombs as the boss starts casting Massive Burst - Massive Burst will do 99% max HP damage to everyone if it finishes - Giddy Bomb does a pointblank AoE that can interrupt the boss's Massive Burst. It can be moved around by attacking it - Lava Bombs are the same as before, and can get in the way of your attempts to move the Giddy Bomb if you're not prepared - Grey and Giddy Bomb spawn locations are static. Locations below are relative to the center and listed per rotation (Grey > Grey > Giddy) - Slightly south > center > slightly north-west - North > slightly south-west > slightly north-east - South > north > slightly north-east - Center > south > center - You can preposition the boss where Giddy Bomb will spawn to avoid having to move the bomb around - You can preposition the boss on first Grey Bomb and use Lust to AoE it along with the boss for a faster kill

data.name: FloorsetNote_PalaceOfTheDead_91
data.value: - Timeline: - phase 1: uses only Abyss until HP reaches 90% - Summon Darkness: spawns 1 Giant Corse and 1 Bicephalic Corse - phase 2: uses Abyss and Shackle until HP reaches 65% - Summon Darkness: spawns 1 Bicephalic Corse and 1 Iron Corse - phase 3: uses Abyss, Shackle, and Word of Pain until HP reaches 40% - Summon Darkness: spawns 1 Iron, 1 Giant, and 1 Bicephalic Corse - phase 4: rotation of Doom > Abyss > Word of Pain > Shackle > Abyss > Word of Pain - Lust can be used to AoE the adds down quickly (3 hits) while also applying vulnerability stacks to the boss - Adds remain on the battlefield when killed, and will be resurrected after a while if not cleared with resolution - Resolution can be used to kill adds in one shot. It can also be used on the corpses to remove them from the battle, preventing them from resurrecting - You'll want to use at least one resolution to clear most, if not all, of the adds. They are likely to overwhelm you otherwise

data.name: FloorsetNote_PalaceOfTheDead_101
data.value: - Rotation: - Whipcrack - Stormwind - Bombination - Lumisphere - Aero Blast

data.name: FloorsetNote_PalaceOfTheDead_111
data.value: - Rotation: - Bloody Caress - Acid Mist - Gold Dust - Leafstorm - Boss runs to north end and stays there until after Rotten Stench phase - Two Deep Palace Hornet adds appear - Rotten Stench x3 - Full rotation takes 56 seconds - Kill adds quickly, or they will use Final Sting, which does 70% max HP damage (each). This can be outranged, but the adds will keep using it repeatedly until it hits or they die - If you use lust during the second Rotten Stench cast, it will last long enough to kill 2 sets of adds. Steel may be needed to survive long enough on non-tanks though - Rotten Stench will one-shot a DPS or healer without steel

data.name: FloorsetNote_PalaceOfTheDead_121
data.value: - Auto-attacks are conal AoEs - Rotation: - Dissever - Ball of Fire - Ball of Ice - Dissever - Ball of Fire - Ball of Ice - Boss runs to center of room - Fear Itself - Make sure to stay out of middle for the fire/ice balls to keep a safe spot for avoiding Fear Itself - Fear Itself is a quicker cast than on floor 30, so get to the center fast

data.name: FloorsetNote_PalaceOfTheDead_131
data.value: - Vulnerable to resolution - Can be killed in under 1 minute on any job using strength and resolution - Rotation: - Ancient Eruption (x4) - Adds: 2 Deep Palace Followers appear - Entropic Flame - Accursed Pox - Entropic Flame - Accursed Pox - Scream - If adds are still alive at this point, prey will cause them to cast Tornado, killing you with 99999 damage - Shadow Flare: roomwide AoE damage - Bleed pool DoT, Entropic Flame, and (presumably) Accursed Pox will one-shot DPS/healers - stay away

data.name: FloorsetNote_PalaceOfTheDead_141
data.value: - Rotation: - Void Fire IV - Summon Darkness (Gargoyle): calls an untargetable gargoyle that will use a large telegraphed line AoE at the same time as Dark Mist - Dark Mist - Summon Darkness (Zombies): calls 4 zombie adds that will slowly crawl towards you. If one touches you, you will be bound until it dies - Void Fire IV - Void Aero - Summon Darkness (Vodoriga): calls an untargetable vodoriga that will use a telegraphed circle AoE just after the next Void Fire IV - Void Fire IV - Dark Mist - Summon Darkness (Succubus): calls a succubus add - in addition to autoattacks, uses Sweet Steel and Void Fire II - Void Aero - Void Fire IV - Fatal Allure - Blood Sword - the HP drain is 1:1, so whether you DPS the add or the boss doesn't matter in terms of damage - Blood Rain - kills any remaining zombies - Entire rotation is about 1m50s - Don't let the zombies catch you - Physical ranged jobs can just kite the zombies until they despawn. It's likely better for others to kill them. They have pretty low HP - If you're not killing the succubus add, it's worth putting DoTs on it anyway - In party play, Summon Darkness (Gargoyle/Vodoriga) summons one add for each party member

data.name: FloorsetNote_PalaceOfTheDead_151
data.value: - Rotation: - Geirrothr - Hall of Sorrow - Valfodr - Flames appear around the edges of the arena and do telegraphed pointblank AoEs at the same time. Make sure to get knocked into a safe spot or use knockback immunity. The flames explode a couple seconds after the knockback, so there is a bit of time to adjust. Flame explosions deal 70% max HP damage - Geirrothr - Hall of Sorrow - Bleed DoT does not stack (standing in overlapping puddles does the same damage as standing in just one) - The flame AoE telegraphs are buggy and sometimes don't display - stay away from the flames even if you don't see the telegraphs

data.name: FloorsetNote_PalaceOfTheDead_161
data.value: - Rotation: - Drench - Electrogenesis - Douse - Fang's End - Hit Sprint when it uses Drench if you're still heavied to escape Electrogenesis safely. Only needed 1 out of every 5 times because of diminshing returns on the heavy (15s > 7s > 3s > resist > resist > 15s) - If you're kiting, it is a good idea to try to pull the boss to the same place every time for Douse. If they're all stacked in one place, it's much easier to keep the boss out of them, reducing damage taken - If not kiting, simply pull him out of the puddle after Douse

data.name: FloorsetNote_PalaceOfTheDead_171
data.value: - Rotation: - Thunderbolt - Charybdis (x2) - Thunderbolt - Trounce; runs to the south end of the arena to cast this - Charybdis (x2) - Thunderbolt - Charybdis - Trounce again, but from the north end - Enters enrage mode at 15% - stands up and casts Ecliptic Meteor, dealing 80% max HP damage to everyone in the party. Continues to cast this over and over until the fight ends - If you are standing in front of him during meteors, he can also autoattack you (so don't do that!) - Most jobs require a very strict strategy to get through this final push. See the job-specific notes below - Useful macros: - Cancel Lust: /statusoff "Transfiguration" - Useful if you have trouble clicking it off quickly - Cancel food: /statusoff "Well Fed" - Again useful if you have trouble cancelling it quickly otherwise - Cancelling food is useful during enrage if you're healing through it because Meteors do damage based on your max HP. Lower max HP means less damage taken, which means less damage to heal - Cancelling your food when not at full HP also acts like a pseudo heal since it lowers your max HP, which actually raises your current HP%

data.name: FloorsetNote_PalaceOfTheDead_181
data.value: - Rotation: - Scalding Scolding - Remedy Bomb (blue) spawns along with several untargetable Giddy Bombs - Remedy Bomb starts using Hypothermal Combustion immediately with a long cast time. It must be killed before this goes off to prevent massive roomwide damage (80% max HP damage + 5s deep freeze) - Giddy Bombs all use Hypothermal Combustion after a few seconds. Theirs is a small telegraphed pointblank AoE with a short cast time, so stay away from them - Sap (x3) - Scalding Scolding - Sap - Lava Bomb (red) spawns along with several Giddy Bombs as the boss starts casting Massive Burst. - Massive Burst will do 99% max HP damage to everyone if it finishes - Lava Bomb does a pointblank AoE that can interrupt the boss's Massive Burst. It can be moved around by attacking it - Giddy Bombs are the same as before, and can get in the way of your attempts to move the Lava Bomb if you're not prepared - Full rotation takes 1 minute, 20 seconds - Remedy Bomb and Lava Bomb spawn locations are static. Knowing the spawn locations of Lava Bombs is especially useful, as you can then pull the boss to where it will spawn, allowing you to to keep uptime on the boss instead of running around to position the bomb - DO NOT open with lust if soloing, as the cleave at the start will destroy you - The safest time to use lust is during the triple Sap cast. Kill the Remedy Bomb as quickly as possible to maximize your time. DO NOT get greedy here. Drop transfiguration immediately regardless of stacks after the third Sap, as you need to be prepared for the cleave that follows - Another option is to use Lust to kill the Remedy Bomb and get stacks on the boss at the same time. It will take 4 hits to kill the Remedy Bomb, so don't delay

data.name: FloorsetNote_PalaceOfTheDead_191
data.value: - You must touch the Firecrest or Glass Pumpkin at the far end of floor 200 to secure your victory. It takes about 35 seconds to run across the floor without Sprint - You gain the title for soloing once you touch the ending. To set it for your screenshots while still inside, use this text command: /title set "The Necromancer"

data.name: AbilityNote_EurekaOrthos_1_12240_31477
data.value: activates random mines, causing them to use Mandrashock

data.name: AbilityNote_EurekaOrthos_1_12240_31479
data.value: proximity AoE on boss - get away; minimum potency at 10y

data.name: AbilityNote_EurekaOrthos_1_12240_31478
data.value: telegraphed pointblank AoE; inflicts vulnerability up (25% per stack, 1m)

data.name: AbilityNote_EurekaOrthos_11_12261_31799
data.value: orders some adds to use Flame Breath

data.name: AbilityNote_EurekaOrthos_11_12261_32545
data.value: orders half of the adds to use Flame Breath, followed shortly by the other half

data.name: AbilityNote_EurekaOrthos_11_12261_1227
data.value: telegraphed line AoE; inflicts vulnerability up (20% per stack, 1m)

data.name: AbilityNote_EurekaOrthos_11_12261_676
data.value: conal AoE with late telegraph; inflicts vulnerability up (20% per stack, 1m)

data.name: AbilityNote_EurekaOrthos_41_12265_1105
data.value: untelegraphed donut AoE - get IN. Only used as part of the Songs and Thunderous Cold / Cold Thunder combos (never used on its own)

data.name: AbilityNote_EurekaOrthos_41_12265_1104
data.value: untelegraphed pointblank AoE - get OUT. Only used as part of the Songs and Thunderous Cold / Cold Thunder combos (never used on its own)

data.name: AbilityNote_EurekaOrthos_41_12265_31851
data.value: Ram's Voice followed by Dragon's Voice - get out, then in

data.name: AbilityNote_EurekaOrthos_41_12265_31852
data.value: Dragon's Voice followed by Ram's Voice - get in, then out

data.name: AbilityNote_EurekaOrthos_41_12265_31861
data.value: untelegraphed 180 degree AoE to the boss's left

data.name: AbilityNote_EurekaOrthos_41_12265_31863
data.value: untelegraphed 180 degree AoE to the boss's right

data.name: AbilityNote_EurekaOrthos_41_12265_31856
data.value: telegraphed charge AoE with tether, followed by Dragon's Voice, followed by Ram's Voice - get far to reduce charge damage, then get in, then out

data.name: AbilityNote_EurekaOrthos_41_12265_31855
data.value: telegraphed charge AoE with tether, followed by Ram's Voice, followed by Dragon's Voice - get far to reduce charge damage, then get out, then in

data.name: AbilityNote_EurekaOrthos_41_12265_1107
data.value: spawns an orb that tethers and chases each party member for a short time before stopping and exploding; runs to the middle to cast this

data.name: AbilityNote_EurekaOrthos_41_12265_1108
data.value: pointblank thunder AoE; used when the orb gets within range of its target or 9 seconds after it starts moving

data.name: AbilityNote_EurekaOrthos_51_12267_31872
data.value: Eight Bullish Swipe telegraphs followed by the actual attacks

data.name: AbilityNote_EurekaOrthos_51_12267_3972
data.value: knockback from center

data.name: AbilityNote_EurekaOrthos_51_12267_30744
data.value: 90 degree conal AoE with late telegraph - get behind; inflicts vulnerability up (20% per stack, 1m)

data.name: AbilityNote_EurekaOrthos_51_12267_31875
data.value: pointblank AoE with late telegraph - get away; inflicts vulnerability up (20% per stack, 1m)

data.name: AbilityNote_EurekaOrthos_51_12267_14463
data.value: roomwide AoE; leaves several orbs scattered around the room; orbs explode in pointblank AoEs in time with the first hit of Octuple Swipe

data.name: AbilityNote_EurekaOrthos_61_12246_10207
data.value: tankbuster

data.name: AbilityNote_EurekaOrthos_61_12246_31442
data.value: untelegraphed charge attack with tether; get far to reduce damage

data.name: AbilityNote_EurekaOrthos_61_12246_31436
data.value: donut AoE if boss has a big blue glowing animation; pointblank AoE otherwise; late telegraph. Inflicts vulnerability up (10% per stack, 30s)

data.name: AbilityNote_EurekaOrthos_61_12246_6293
data.value: causes many rocks and crystals to fall from the ceiling causing circle AoEs; 4 crystals are left behind. Crystals do AoEs with late telegraphs with the next Preternatural Turn - see notes below

data.name: AbilityNote_EurekaOrthos_61_12246_516
data.value: pointblank AoE (magic damage) if boss has a big blue glowing animation; wide conal AoE (physical damage) otherwise; late telegraph. Inflicts vulnerability up (10% per stack, 30s)

data.name: AbilityNote_EurekaOrthos_71_12247_2923
data.value: conal AoE tankbuster

data.name: AbilityNote_EurekaOrthos_71_12247_2927
data.value: creates damage zones in center (instant death) and outer ring (unique DoT potency 200) of arena

data.name: AbilityNote_EurekaOrthos_71_12247_2939
data.value: inflicts positive or negative charge to each player and spawns four adds outside the arena with positive or negative charge markers; also re-creates the instant death zone in the center of the arena

data.name: AbilityNote_EurekaOrthos_71_12247_2617
data.value: telegraphed line AoEs across the arena, forming an 'X'; used periodically - see rotation below

data.name: AbilityNote_EurekaOrthos_71_12247_31423
data.value: wide conal AoE to the front; the boss turns to face the target before using this

data.name: AbilityNote_EurekaOrthos_71_12247_31424
data.value: 180 degree AoE to the boss's left and behind

data.name: AbilityNote_EurekaOrthos_71_12247_31425
data.value: 180 degree AoE to the boss's right and behind

data.name: AbilityNote_EurekaOrthos_71_12247_31426
data.value: donut AoE with late telegraph - only a narrow ring around the center is safe; instant death zone in center disappears right after this

data.name: AbilityNote_EurekaOrthos_81_12102_31449
data.value: spawns Interceptor adds. α (eggs) will do wide conal AoEs, β (cubes) will do line AoEs, γ (spheres) will do a donut AoE, all with late telegraphs. The timing of these is determined by the boss's next move. See rotation for more details

data.name: AbilityNote_EurekaOrthos_81_12102_31450
data.value: places 1/2/3 markers on the adds to indicate the order they will fire in

data.name: AbilityNote_EurekaOrthos_81_12102_31454
data.value: causes adds in each set to fire one at a time from left to right while 5 consecutive circle AoEs also appear on players

data.name: AbilityNote_EurekaOrthos_81_12102_31455
data.value: orders all adds to fire at once

data.name: AbilityNote_EurekaOrthos_81_12102_31447
data.value: telegraphed donut AoE

data.name: AbilityNote_EurekaOrthos_81_12102_31448
data.value: cross AoE (lines through front-back and sides) - get to corners (oriented with boss/animation)

data.name: AbilityNote_EurekaOrthos_81_12102_31456
data.value: roomwide AoE

data.name: AbilityNote_EurekaOrthos_81_12102_3943
data.value: AoE with late telegraph; shape varies with add (see rotation)

data.name: AbilityNote_EurekaOrthos_91_12100_31353
data.value: roomwide AoE; grants Soul of Ice or Soul of Fire to each player; if there are Caliburni swords, this imbues one set with fire, and another with ice

data.name: AbilityNote_EurekaOrthos_91_12100_31333
data.value: telegraphed line AoEs leaving swords that persist outside the arena. After a short time, the swords shoot back across

data.name: AbilityNote_EurekaOrthos_91_12100_31349
data.value: Line and roomwide AoE; One side of the arena will be hit with fire, the other with ice. Stand OUTSIDE of the line telegraph, and on the side opposite of the buff you have. This will change your buff.

data.name: AbilityNote_EurekaOrthos_91_12100_31338
data.value: Setup cast - nothing actually happens

data.name: AbilityNote_EurekaOrthos_91_12100_31327
data.value: pointblank AoE with late telegraph - get out; followed by arc or conal AoEs

data.name: AbilityNote_EurekaOrthos_91_12100_31328
data.value: donut AoE with late telegraph - get in; followed by arc or conal AoEs

data.name: AbilityNote_EurekaOrthos_91_12100_1733
data.value: conal AoEs with Solid/Empty Souls' Caliber

data.name: AbilityNote_EurekaOrthos_91_12100_31330
data.value: indicates Frost's Revelation will happen after next Souls' Caliber, so you'll need to get the fire buff

data.name: AbilityNote_EurekaOrthos_91_12100_31329
data.value: indicates Flame's Revelation will happen after next Souls' Caliber, so you'll need to get the ice buff

data.name: AbilityNote_EurekaOrthos_91_12100_31332
data.value: roomwide ice-aspected AoE - must have fire buff; switches your buff to ice

data.name: AbilityNote_EurekaOrthos_91_12100_31345
data.value: spawns 2 sets of 3 circle AoEs that turn into star AoEs. Outside the center ring of the arena, there is a pattern with 8 points. Each of these points is a safe spot for all possible patterns

data.name: AbilityNote_EurekaOrthos_91_12100_31343
data.value: spawns a series of circles that grow and explode; you can run clockwise around the boss's hitbox to avoid them

data.name: AbilityNote_EurekaOrthos_91_12100_31336
data.value: return attack from Caliburni swords (fire element)

data.name: AbilityNote_EurekaOrthos_91_12100_31337
data.value: return attack from Caliburni swords (ice element)

data.name: AbilityNote_EurekaOrthos_91_12100_31347
data.value: line AoEs from Exglacialis stars

data.value: telegraphed circle AoE

data.name: AbilityNote_HeavenOnHigh_1_7480_8025
data.value: inflicts knockback; knockback immunity does not work

data.name: AbilityNote_HeavenOnHigh_1_7480_8022
data.value: telegraphed half room AoE; inflicts vulnerability up (40% per stack, max 16 stacks, 45s)

data.name: AbilityNote_HeavenOnHigh_11_7481_390
data.value: instant

data.name: AbilityNote_HeavenOnHigh_11_7481_5574
data.value: huge telegraphed conal AoE; inflicts confused (10s)

data.value: 360 degree gaze inflicting confused (10s) - look away!

data.value: telegraphed pointblank AoE; inflicts paralysis (30s)

data.value: telegraphed line AoE

data.name: AbilityNote_HeavenOnHigh_21_7478_6009
data.value: summons Raiuns (untargetable lightning cloud adds)

data.value: untelegraphed circle AoE

data.value: telegraphed line AoE; inflicts windburn (magic DoT potency 50, 30s)

data.value: pointblank AoE; inflicts windburn (magic DoT potency 50, 30s)

data.value: telegraphed conal AoE; inflicts knockback

data.value: triggered whenever you touch an add

data.name: AbilityNote_EurekaOrthos_31_4562_671
data.value: spawns a little tornado under you; instant death if you are standing on it, so make sure you're moving as the cast completes

data.name: AbilityNote_EurekaOrthos_31_4562_31462
data.value: many circle AoEs leaving behind tornados that remain until after Turbine; stepping in one deals damage (magic potency 125) and inflicts windburn (magic DoT potency 250, 6s) which cannot be removed with Esuna

data.name: AbilityNote_EurekaOrthos_31_4562_31465

data.name: AbilityNote_EurekaOrthos_31_4562_4116
data.value: knockback from center

data.name: AbilityNote_EurekaOrthos_31_4562_9906
